page.title: 01River Witham & Langriville
page.content: The agricultural land in this area is 99 percent arable. Main crops grown are cereals, potatoes, sugar beet, peas & rape. There are lighter patches of soil in some areas growing vegetables and bulbs amounting to 8% of the area. The land appearance is level with slight rises and the whole of the area is bordering on sea level. The River Witham which crosses the area is a navigable water way. Its main useful purpose is to carry the highland drainage water to the sea. The area is used for boating and water recreational sports. The whole area is drained by drains such as the North Forth Foot and Castledyke Drains which go through this area. The housing of the area is for Agricultural Workers and rural based industries.
